dt: {bc}to cause anger, irritation, or deep bitterness

et: Middle English {it}ranclen{/it} to fester, from Anglo-French {it}rancler{/it}, from Old French {it}draoncler, raoncler{/it}, from {it}draoncle, raoncle{/it} festering sore, from Medieval Latin {it}dracunculus{/it}, from Latin, diminutive of {it}draco{/it} serpent {ma}{mat|dragon|}{/ma}
shortdef: to cause anger, irritation, or deep bitterness
to cause irritation or bitterness in
